definition: to make a logical or causal connection
details:
verb
- to make a logical or causal connection
= example: to make a logical or causal connection
= synonyms: link
- to join for the purpose of communication
= example: to join for the purpose of communication
- to join by means of communication equipment
= example: to join by means of communication equipment
- to land on or hit solidly
= example: to land on or hit solidly
- to connect, fasten, or put together two or more pieces
= example: to connect, fasten, or put together two or more pieces
= synonyms: link
- to hit or play a ball successfully
= example: to hit or play a ball successfully
- to plug into an outlet
= synonyms: plug in, plug into
- to establish communication with someone
= example: to establish communication with someone
= synonyms: get in touch, touch base
- to establish a rapport or relationship
= example: to establish a rapport or relationship
- to be or become joined, united, or linked
= example: to be or become joined, united, or linked
= synonyms: link
- to be scheduled so as to provide continuing service, as in transportation
= example: to be scheduled so as to provide continuing service, as in transportation
